newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cash crudes still weak on heavy imports early.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cash crudes still weak on heavy imports early.

text.p: U.S. cash crude prices sustained a weak tone early Thursday amid a continuing barrage of crude imports, traders said.
"There's still a lot of concern about the waterborn stuff coming in," one Texas traders said. "It could get ugly before its all over."
Despite a narrow 95 cent spread between West Texas Intermediate/Cushing and North Sea Brent, Swiss-based trading house Glencore continues to show Brents on the Gulf Coast.
WTI/Cushing was trading around $20.75-85 a barrel, up 15 cents from the NYMEX close on Wednesday.
